Draw the following lines and arcs to form a series of closed loops on the sketch: 1. Line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) 2. Line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.1667) 3. Line from (0.75, 0.1667) to (0.6167, 0.1667) 4. Line from (0.6167, 0.1667) to (0.6167, 0.0833) 5. Line from (0.6167, 0.0833) to (0.5167, 0.0833) 6. Line from (0.5167, 0.0833) to (0.5167, 0.25) 7. Line from (0.25, 0.25) to (0.0, 0.25) 12. Transform the scaled sketch into 3D by applying a 3D rotation using the Euler angles from the coordinate system, followed by a translation using the translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 3D sketch along its normal vector by 0.0833 units to create a new solid body. This completes the construction of part 1 with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0833 - Height: 0.75 This part represents a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.</description>

Draw the second line from point (0.75, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.5323). c. Draw the third line from point (0.75, 0.5323) to point (0.0, 0.5323). d. Draw the fourth line from point (0.0, 0.5323) to point (0.0, 0.2722). e. Draw the fifth line from point (0.0, 0.2722) to point (0.0, 0.0). 3. **Add the circular cutouts to the prism's face.** a. Add the first circle centered at (0.2601, 0.2722) with a radius of 0.0181. b. Add the second circle centered at (0.6108, 0.0847) with a radius of 0.0181. c. Add the third circle centered at (0.6108, 0.2661) with a radius of 0.0181. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D sketch.** Set the scaling parameter `sketch_scale` to 0.75, and set euler angles and translation vector as described before. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** Set the extrude depth towards and opposite the normal to 0.0605 and 0.0, respectively. Perform a "new body" operation to create an independent 3D body. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.0938, creating a 3D model of the prism with a tapered middle section. The length of the prism is 0.75, the width is 0.0938, and the height is 0.75.</description>

The top, bottom and side edges should be sharp and straight, and the object should be symmetrical along its central axis.</description>
